attributes.action: call a General Election to allow the electorate to decide whether or not they think that he is, as he claims, the right man to take the country through these difficult times.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Gordon Brown has never submitted himself to the electorate since succeeding his predecessor as Prime Minister. Whilst Constitutionally this is perfectly proper, there is no precedent in modern times for such an unpopular, unelected, Prime Minister to cling to office for such a long period of time without going to the country. If the Prime Minister is going to be anything other than a lame duck at home and abroad, he surely needs to secure a mandate from the country. Failure to do so would damage the interests of the country domestically and internationally.
